article.title: Perturbation, Non-Gaussianity and Reheating in a GB-$Î±$-Attractor Model

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red star in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The point where the tensor-to-scalar ratio is maximized.
The point where the model\'s predictions converge in the small \'a\' limit.
The point representing the Planck2015 best-fit values for ns and r.
The point where the model becomes incompatible with observational data.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the general trend observed for the tensor-to-scalar ratio (r) as the Gauss-Bonnet coupling parameter (Go) increases?
choices: \'r\' remains constant regardless of changes in Go.
\'r\' generally decreases with increasing Go.
\'r\' generally increases with increasing Go.
The relationship between \'r\' and Go is not clear from the figure.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the large \'a\' limit, what determines the values of the tensor-to-scalar ratio (r) and the scalar spectral index (ns)?
choices: The value of the parameter \'n\' in the potential.
The values of both the potential (V) and the Gauss-Bonnet coupling function (G).
The value of the sound speed (cs) of the perturbations.
The number of e-folds of inflation (N) after the relevant CMB scales cross the horizon.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 suggest about the compatibility of this GB-a-attractor model with observational data?
choices: The model is incompatible with observational data for any value of \'a\' and Go.
The model is compatible with observational data for all values of \'a\' and Go.
The model is compatible with observational data only in the small \'a\' limit.
The model is compatible with observational data for certain ranges of \'a\' and Go.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the nonlinearity parameter (fNL) quantify?
choices: The deviation of the inflaton field from its minimum potential value.
The amplitude of the non-Gaussianity of the primordial perturbations.
The sound speed (cs) of the scalar perturbations.
The tensor-to-scalar ratio (r) of the cosmological perturbations.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does ND represent in the formula for fNL?
choices: The number of e-folds of inflation.
The scalar spectral index.
A parameter derived from the three-point correlation function of the scalar perturbations.
The ratio of the tensor power spectrum to the scalar power spectrum.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Trh represent in this formula?
choices: The current temperature of the universe.
The temperature at the end of inflation.
The temperature during the reheating epoch.
The temperature at which the electroweak symmetry is broken.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the parameter Weff in determining Trh?
choices: It represents the number of relativistic degrees of freedom during reheating.
It quantifies the strength of the Gauss-Bonnet coupling during reheating.
It describes the effective equation of state of the energy density dominating during reheating.
It determines the duration of the reheating epoch.
